Class SeeWithEars.Hilbert

  • java.lang.Object
    • SeeWithEars.Hilbert
  • Enclosing class:
    SeeWithEars

    public class SeeWithEars.Hilbert
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that sorts the pixels in the order of the hilbert curve. The functionality and the comments of the sortFunction and revSortFunction are based on the algorithm of princeton university: https://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/32class/Hilbert.java.html

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int counter
      Used to copy the pixel to the right spot in the array

      The order of the hilbert curve.
      private int NUM_STATES
      The number of different states (left, right, up, down)
      private int picWidth
      The widht of the given image.
      private int state
      The state is used to determine which pixels is added next.
      private int x

      private int y
      YValue.

    • Field Detail

      • hilbertOrder

        private int hilbertOrder
        The order of the hilbert curve. Is set by the final HILBERTORDER variable in the SeeWithEars class.

      • state

        private int state
        The state is used to determine which pixels is added next.

        The number of different states (left, right, up, down)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hilbert

        public Hilbert(int hilbertOrder)
        Standard constructor. Sets the Hilbert Order.
        Parameters:
        hilbertOrder - The designated hilbert order

    • Method Detail

      • hilbertSort

        public float[] hilbertSort(int[] pix,
                           float[] sortedPixels,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int picWidth)
        Overhead of the recursive functions that are sorting the pixels according to the hilbert curve.
        Parameters:
        pix - The pixels of the image
        sortedPixels - The array that stores the sorted Pixels of the image (has to be the same size like pix)
        x - The x variable of the starting point of the hilbert curve
        y - The y variable of the starting point of the hilbert curve
        picWidth - The width of the given picture
        Returns:
        float[] The array of the sorted Pixels. TODO: Is it really necessary to parse the sortedPixels array and the x and y variable?

      • sortPixels

        private float[] sortPixels(int[] pix,
                           float[] sortedPixels,
                           int recDeep)
        Recursive function that sorts the pixels.
        Parameters:
        pix - The pixels of the image
        sortedPixels - The array that stores the sorted Pixels of the image (has to be the same size like pix)
        recDeep - The depth of the recursion. Break condition.
        Returns:
        float[] The sorted pixel array

      • revSortPixels

        private float[] revSortPixels(int[] pix,
                              float[] sortedPixels,
                              int recDeep)
        The reverse sorting pixels algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pix - The pixels of the image
        sortedPixels - The array that stores the sorted Pixels of the image (has to be the same size like pix)
        recDeep - The depth of the recursion. Break condition.
        Returns:
        float[] The sorted pixel array

      • refreshXY

        private void refreshXY()
        Update the x and y coordinate depending of the state set by the sorting function.

      • getHilbertOrder

        public int getHilbertOrder()
        Return the Hilbert Order that is used.
        Returns:
        int The hilbert order that is used.
